Castletownberehaven, also known as Castletownbere or Castletown for short. It is located in the middle of the Beara Peninsula. This picturesque town has a population of about 868 (2006 census). It is a chief fishing port in
and consequently fishing is the main economic activity.
The closest airports to the town are Kerry Airport (98 kms, 2 hours) and Cork International Airport (125 kms, 2 hours). Getting there with your own car is best. From
, head west firstly on the N71 and take a left in Glengariff onto the R572, which will lead directly to Castletownbere. The travelling time by car from
city is about 2 hours or from Bantry it is about 45 minutes. Cycling to the town is also possible. From
city, you can take the Bus Eireann 236 (Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays only).
Walking is the best if you don't have a car, as the town is small enough and the distances aren't too great. Unfortunately, there are no taxis or bus services in the town.

value: content= An elegant and large manor house previously owned by the Puxley family. Burnt down by the IRA in 1920 and remained in this gutted from fire condition until about 2010 when renovations began to restore it to its former glory. These renovations appear to be halted as of 2014 and the house is surrounded by barricades. Located beside the ruins of Dunboy Castle.
content=Now only the ruins remain of this once powerful stronghold of the O'Sullivan Bere clan. It was destroyed in the famous Siege of Dunboy in June 1602.

content=An old Church of Ireland graveyard that hasn't received new burials since the mid 19th century. Some of the gravestones are still legible. At the west wall, there is a mass famine grave from the famine of the 1840s.
hours=M-F, 10AM-5PM; Sa-Su, 1-5PM (phone for opening times outside of June-August)
content=A heritage museum with displays and exhibitions about local maritime life in the Beara Peninsula.
name=Take a ferry to Bere Island.
content=Get a car ferry from opposite Murphy's SuperValu to Bere Island opposite. There are many things to see on Bere Island, including Martello Towers, a museum and the village of Rerrin.
content=The town and the surrounding area are great and scenic places to cycle, weather permitting.
content=Pleasant little cafe with hefty portions and excellent home baking on offer.
content=One of the best restaurants in the town. Good value portions of standard food but seafood dishes are the best on offer.
content=Iconic pub and subject of an eponymous book by Pete McCarthy. Is also a grocery shop. Frequent live music and a snug inside the front door.
